issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task list) specifies a method addGuestStudents(int) but the template provides a method stub addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput). The solution implements addGuestStudents(int) (single parameter). The mismatched parameter list in the template contradicts the specification and the reference solution and will confuse students about which signature to implement and may cause test/compilation mismatches.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template method signature to match the problem statement and solution: provide public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents). If input validation is desired, either implement validation inside that single-parameter method or add an additional overloaded private/public method (e.g., addGuestStudents(int, boolean)) while keeping the single-parameter public API expected by the exercise/tests.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task text) defines a method addGuestStudents(int): void to add new guest students. The solution implements public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) (single int parameter). However the template's stub declares public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput) with an extra boolean parameter. This discrepancy in the method signature (same conceptual operation but different parameter lists) creates a mapping barrier: students reading the problem expect to implement/complete addGuestStudents(int), but the provided template has a different signature which may confuse them and cause compilation/test mismatches.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the template with the problem statement and solution by changing the template method signature to public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents). If input validation is desired, either implement it internally in that single-parameter method or provide an overloaded helper (e.g., a private validate method or an overloaded public addGuestStudents(int, boolean) alongside the single-parameter method) and update the TODO comment to reflect the chosen approach.
